Thus De Ecclesia, by Hus, has just as many chapters as the same work by Wyclif. And as Hus takes from Wyclif’s De Ecclesia all his theoretical expositions on the subject and sets them forth as his own ideas concerning the Church, so the idea of Papal Power and the description of its evolution is taken word for word, though more or less faithfully‚ from Wyclif’s De Potestatc Pape. Years ago I selected passages and pointed out their similarity. The text of the work in hand contains an accurate list of the pas- sages appropriated by Hus in his De Ecclesia.
